uniovi.assign.greedy

Class GreedyAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniovi.assign.greedy.GreedyAlgorithm

  • public class GreedyAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    Singletone that contains the greedy algorithm for making the assignments of students to class groups.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(CollisionMatrix collisionMatrix,
                       java.util.List<Group> allGroups,
                       java.util.Map<Group,java.util.List<Group>> assigmentPreferences,
                       Planification planification)
        Initialize the information needed by the greedy algorithm in order to execute
        Parameters:
        collisionMatrix - collision matrix that contains the information about the collisions between class groups.
        allGroups - list containing all the groups that exist in the planification
        assigmentPreferences - assignment preferences determined by the user
        planification - planification of the school

      • execute

        public Individual execute(Individual individual)
        Executes the greedy algorithm over an individual. It makes all the assigments in the order that is specified by the individual. The algorithm tries to assign the class group with lower number of students that does not collide with the current assignments of the student.

        If it is not possible to make the assignment, a repairing process takes place trying to change some assignments of the student in order to allow the new assignment. When a group is assigned, the algorithms also tries to assign the set of preferences that the user has introduced for the assigned group, if they exists.

        Parameters:
        individual - individual to be evaluated by the greedy algorithm and whose assignments have to be made.
        Returns:
        the individual with the list of assignments solved, the list of unsolved assignments and some statistics about the quality of the generated solution.
